intro: Acranthera velutinervia, commonly known as the velvet-veined acranthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Acranthera velutinervia is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
